meanings.sent1: I will omit the last paragraph from my essay.
meanings.sent2: Don't forget to omit any unnecessary details from the report.
meanings.sent3: It would be funny if you accidentally omit your own name from the guest list.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was so captivating that it made me want to omit all distractions and just listen.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret ingredient was so potent that it was impossible to omit its unique flavor.

meanings.sent1: If you omit the key information, your argument may not be convincing.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had to omit the important detail from her presentation.
meanings.sent3: It would be a shame to omit such a crucial piece of evidence from the case.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece was so detailed that it was impossible to omit any part of it.
meanings.sent5: The detective knew he couldn't afford to omit any potential clue in his investigation.
